intro: Maesa angustibracteolata, commonly known as the narrow-bract maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, evergreen leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
